meanings.sent1: The woald was filled with tall trees and chirping birds.
meanings.sent2: We decided to explore the woald to see its beauty up close.
meanings.sent3: The woald seemed to whisper secrets to those who dared to enter.
meanings.sent4: The woald stood like a giant green blanket covering the land.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the woald, creating a magical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To produce a loud, high-pitched cry.
meanings.sent1: The baby bird would woald for its mother when hungry.
meanings.sent2: The singer would woald out the high notes with ease.
meanings.sent3: The cat would woald loudly when it wanted attention.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock seemed to woald at an unbearable volume.
meanings.sent5: The child would woald in delight when playing with their favorite toy.

meanings.sent1: The garden had turned into a woald of weeds during the winter.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house was surrounded by a woald of overgrown bushes.
meanings.sent3: The playground became a woald of chaos during recess.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a woald of conflicting thoughts and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The old attic was a woald of forgotten treasures waiting to be discovered.
